1: How long, O Yahweh? Will you forget me forever? How long will you hide your face from me?
2: How long must I take counsel[b] in my soul, and sorrow in my heart all the day? How long will my enemy be exalted over me?
3: Consider[c] and answer me, O Yahweh my God. Give light to my eyes lest I sleep the sleep of death,
4: and lest my enemy should say, “I have overcome him,” lest my enemies rejoice because I am shaken.
5: But as for me, I have trusted in your steadfast love.[d] My heart will rejoice in your deliverance.
6: [e] I will sing to Yahweh because he has dealt bountifully with me.
